method.name: Quade Test and Post-Hoc Procedures

reference.ref: J. Zar, Biostatistical Analysis, Prentice Hall, Upper Saddle River, New Jersey, 1999.
D. Sheskin, Handbook of parametric and nonparametric statistical procedures. Chapman and Hall/CRC, 2003.
J. Demsar, Statistical comparisons of classifiers over multiple data sets. Journal of Machine Learning Research 7 (2006) 1-30

generalDescription.objective: Execution of the non-parametric Friedman test and post-hoc tests for comparison of the global performance of several classification methods.
generalDescription.howWork: The Friedman test considers all data sets to be equal in terms of importance. An alternative to this could take into account the fact that some data sets are more difficult or the differences registered on the run of various algorithms over them are larger. The rankings computed on each data set could be scaled depending on the differences observed in the algorithms performances. The Quade test conducts a weighted ranking analysis of the sample of results.

parameterSpec.param: Apply-Iman-Davenport: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Iman and Davenport test
Apply-Bonferroni-Dunn: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Bonferroni-Dunn test
Apply-Holm: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Holm test
Apply-Hochberg: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Hochberg test
Apply-Hommel: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Hommel test
Apply-Holland: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Holland test
Apply-Rom: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Rom test
Apply-Finner: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Finner test
Apply-Li: It can takes the value YES or NO if the user desires to apply the Li test

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Methods to compare: Clas-KNN vs Clas-C45 vs Clas-Fuzzy-Chi Datasets: cleveland, glass, iris, monks-2, pima Default Parameters (all the post-hoc tests are applied) Type of partitions: k-fold, k=10
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/Stat-Clas-Quade/TSTClas-KNNvsClas-C45vsClas-Fuzzy-Chi folder the results0s0.stat file:
------------------------------------------------------------ Quade Test, Classification Classification error in each foldfold: Algorithm = Clas-KNN Fold 0 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 1 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 2 : 0.4 Fold 3 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 4 : 0.3333333333333333 Fold 5 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 6 : 0.3870967741935484 Fold 7 : 0.5483870967741935 Fold 8 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 9 : 0.4838709677419355 Mean Value: 0.4686021505376344 Algorithm = Clas-C45 Fold 0 : 0.4 Fold 1 : 0.5333333333333333 Fold 2 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 3 : 0.5 Fold 4 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 5 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 6 : 0.45161290322580644 Fold 7 : 0.41935483870967744 Fold 8 : 0.5333333333333333 Fold 9 : 0.41935483870967744 Mean Value: 0.4556989247311828 Algorithm = Clas-Fuzzy-Chi Fold 0 : 0.4 Fold 1 : 0.4 Fold 2 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 3 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 4 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 5 : 0.5 Fold 6 : 0.5161290322580645 Fold 7 : 0.4838709677419355 Fold 8 : 0.4 Fold 9 : 0.45161290322580644 Mean Value: 0.43516129032258066 --------------------------------------------------------------
and a LaTeX output file "output.tex" where the results of the application of the test are provided.
